Speaker: story by
Dialogue: Rick Berman & Brannon Braga & Ronald D. Moore  Screenplay by Brannon Braga & Ronald D. Moore

Speaker: first draft
Dialogue: September 29, 1995

Speaker: borg
Dialogue: Restrict search parameters to 1-9-

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: Stop search. Calculate temporal coordinates. J-Fourteen.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Signal the Endeavor to fall back. We'll cover them.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Dispersive armor is holding.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Bring us about. Target Borg ship alpha four, port side battery.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Port battery, ready sir!

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Fire.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Starboard battery -- fire.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: The Borg ship has modified its shields, Captain. Our phasers will no longer be effective.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Ready quantum torpedo.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Aye, sir. Only three left.

Speaker: geordi's com voice
Dialogue: La Forge to bridge.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Go ahead.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Captain, I'm starting to worry about the hull integrity. We've been running the support field at full power for three hours straight. I don't know how much longer it's going to hold up.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Understood. Keep me informed.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Incoming transmission from the Borg.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: On screen.

Speaker: borg
Dialogue: Your defense perimeter is useless. You will be assimilated.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Break off your attack. By now, you must realize you can't win...

Speaker: borg
Dialogue: Your opinion is irrelevant. We are the Borg. Resistance is futile.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: We'll see about that...  Fire.  Worf works.  19   EXT. SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE - CLOSE ON TORPEDO BAY          19  A QUANTUM TORPEDO BLASTS out of the launcher and heads toward the Borg cube. This torpedo is completely different than the traditional photon torpedo. It oscillates and changes shape and color as it streaks toward the Borg ship.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Main power still on-line, Captain.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Casualties are light, Captain. Minor buckling on the port nacelle. Nothing serious.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Incoming message from the Starship Intrepid. Admiral Hayes.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: On screen.

Speaker: admiral hayes
Dialogue: The new quantum torpedoes are doing the trick, Jean-Luc. We've destroyed forty-seven Borg ships so far... and only lost fifteen of our own.  But one of the Borg ships has broken through our defenses, and it's heading directly for Earth. Can you handle it?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Absolutely.

Speaker: admiral hayes
Dialogue: Good hunting. Hayes out.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Mister Data, set a pursuit course. Maximum warp.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: We are approaching the Terran System, Captain.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Go to impulse. Where's the Borg ship?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: It has entered Earth orbit.  Correction -- it is not in orbit. It is heading directly toward the surface.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Some sort of suicide tactic?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Unknown, sir. Suicide tactics are not normally associated with the Borg.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Sensors show a temporal signature emanating from the Sphere. High concentrations of tachyons...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: And chronometric particles... it's as though they're trying to create a temporal vortex...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Time travel... they're attempting time travel...  Full power, Mister Data. Worf, quantum torpedoes at my command!

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Aye, sir.  25   EXT. EARTH'S ATMOSPHERE                                     25  The Borg Sphere GLOWING RED and beginning to burn with friction as it PLUMMETS toward Earth...  26   NEW ANGLE - THE ENTERPRISE                                  26  plunging down into the atmosphere, giving chase...

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Range -- fifty kilometers.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: A temporal vortex is forming directly ahead of the Sphere.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Main power off-line!

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Switching to emergency back-ups.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: We're caught in some kind of energy wake from the vortex...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Worf... torpedo... now!

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I have helm control.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Where's the Sphere?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: They have traveled into the vortex... through time.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: The vortex is collapsing, sir.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Contact Starfleet Command.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: No response.  I'm not reading any Starfleet com traffic in this entire sector.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Captain, I've scanned the planet. The atmosphere contains a high concentration of methane, carbon monoxide and fluorine. The oceans have been chemically altered, as well.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: On screen.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Life signs?

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Population... thirty-five billion...  All Borg.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: So is the moon... and three other planets in this solar system.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: But how?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: They must've done it in the past... they went back and changed history...

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: They did it... they assimilated Earth.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: But if they changed history... then why are we still here?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: We were caught in the temporal wake from the vortex. It must have protected us from any changes in the time-line.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Captain, there are five Borg ships closing in on our position.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Data, set a course for that vortex.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Captain...?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: We have to follow them back... repair whatever damage they've done to that time-line.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Course laid in. Engaging impulse engines.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Hull integrity down to thirty percent...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Steady as she goes.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Borg vessels are closing to two thousand meters.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Take us in!

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Report.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: We're still in Earth orbit.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: On screen.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: What year is it?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: According to our astrometric

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Captain, I've found the Borg Sphere. It's on the far side of the planet...firing at the surface.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Weapons status?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Phasers are off-line... we have two quantum torpedoes left. But the computer targeting system has been destroyed.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Go to manual.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Track their weapons fire.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Western hemisphere... North American continent...

Speaker: data
Dialogue: We are within torpedo range.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: They've seen us. They're taking evasive action.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Mister Worf?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Target...

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Captain, they're firing at a nuclear missile silo... in central Montana.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Target...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Montana...

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Target locked!

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Fire!

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Give me a damage report on that missile silo.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Today is March second, 2063. The time in Montana is oh-eight-forty- five.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Looks like they damaged the silo...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Life signs?

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Can't tell. Long-range bio- sensors are off-line.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Worf, have Doctor Crusher, Mister La Forge and a security team meet me in Transporter Room Three. Civilian clothes.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Captain?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: In twenty-four hours, Zephram Cochrane is supposed to conduct the very first warp test... from a missile silo in Montana. If I'm right, the Borg were trying to change the course of human history by killing him or destroying his ship.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: As First Officer I should be the one beaming down...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Normally, I would agree. But in this case, the mission requires a certain knowledge of 21st century history. You're many things, Number One, but you're not much of an historian.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Good luck, sir.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I'll keep in contact. You have the Bridge.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Will somebody please tell me where we're going?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Montana.  Energize.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Montana? Well, that answers everything. Why the hell are we --

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: -- going to Montana?

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: I have the silo, sir. Bearing three one zero... distance, three hundred meters.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Let's go.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Go where? Hello? Is anyone going to tell me what we're doing here?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: We're here to find Zephram Cochrane. He may be injured or dead.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Cochrane... the inventor of warp drive?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: But he's been dead for three hundred...  Oh God... we've gone back in time again, haven't we?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I'm afraid so. If the Borg succeed in preventing First Contact with the Vulcans... Earth will remain in the Second Dark Age... an easy target when the Borg arrive in the 24th century.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Well, why didn't you just say so in the first place?

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Lieutenant Sandra Farrel.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: It appears death was caused by a plasma discharge.  I'll note in her record that she never left her post.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Did you know her?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Not very well. We met shortly after the Enterprise-E was commissioned. I found her to be a most... promising officer.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Data... are you sure you're all right?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I am still having difficulty integrating certain emotions into my programming. Grief, loss, remorse...

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: We still have to make reports on ten more crewmen killed in action. Maybe you should deactivate your emotion chip until we're done.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: No. Human beings do not have that luxury, and neither should I.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: I will admit... there are times when I wish I had an emotion chip I could turn on and off.

Speaker: riker's com voice
Dialogue: Riker to Data.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Go ahead, Commander.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: We're reading some kind of gas leak in the Environmental Control Room. Take a repair team down and check it out.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: On my way, Commander.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: One of the diathermic oxygen tanks has been damaged.

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: Diathermic oxygen?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: It is a new subsystem of Nova Class ships. It regulates hydropressure and temperature variance.  Remain here. The gas is highly corrosive to organic material. It would liquefy your flesh on contact.

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: Be my guest, sir.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Begin a diagnostic on the safety interlocks. There appears to have been some damage during the attack.

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: What the hell...

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Ensign Porter?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Ensign... are you all right?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Data to Bridge.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Data to Security.  This is Lieutenant Data to anyone who can hear my signal. I need assistance in the Environmental Control Room.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: This must be it.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: How serious is the damage?

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: I'm having trouble scanning underground. There's a lot of radiation leaking from something.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Probably from the nuclear warhead. Cochrane was planning to use it to ignite the warp drive.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: This will protect us from the radiation.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: I'm picking up faint life signs twenty meters below.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: There should be an access hatch nearby...

Speaker: lange
Dialogue: Over here.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Alphanumeric lock. We need a password to get in...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I have the password right here.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: See if any of these men are Cochrane.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Mitchell... DePaul...

Speaker: lange
Dialogue: This one's a woman... named Kirby.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: There's a life sign behind this door... about ten meters below.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Blast door. It's designed to protect the control room when the missile is launched.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: There should be some kind of manual release...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Get those fires out and then try to restore main power to the control room.

Speaker: lange
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Got it, Captain.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: There.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Severe radiation exposure...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: It's Cochrane.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: I've stabilized him for now... but he's in a coma and he's going to need radiometric therapy. I want to take him to the ship.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Picard to Enterprise.  Enterprise, please respond.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: It could be the radiation, Captain. Try from the surface.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Mister La Forge, listen very carefully. If you remember your history... in less than twenty- four hours, a Vulcan ship will be passing through this system. When it does, this ship needs to be in space, flying at warp speed.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: I'd better get started.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: It's not the radiation... and there's nothing wrong with the combadges... the Enterprise just isn't responding.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Jean-Luc, this man needs medical attention, now.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: As I recall, the town of Resurrection is about two kilometers East of here. They might have a hospital...

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: What are we waiting for? Let's go.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: It may not be that simple. This is an extremely difficult and paranoid time in human history.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Are you saying they won't help us?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I'm saying they might shoot us on sight. You have to remember... these people have watched their entire way of life collapse around them.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: There must be some good people... even in this time.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Let's hope so. Because if Cochrane dies... the future may die with him.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: I have assigned two damage control teams to locate the source of our communication problems. So far, they've had no success.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Assign another team if you need to. I want to re-establish communication with the Captain as soon as possible.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Are we in any danger of being detected by Earth defense systems?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: There were no planetary defense systems in this era. Their weapons were designed to fight each other... not extraterrestrials.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: We have to start thinking about a way to get home.  Analyze our readings from the temporal vortex. We're going to have to recreate whatever the Borg did to --

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Report.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: We just lost main power... and we've got Class-Three alerts all over the ship. I'm not sure what's --

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: A ship-wide decompression has been initiated!

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: We're venting our internal atmosphere directly into space!

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: What the hell is happening, Worf?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: It appears that someone has taken over the Environmental Control Room.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Someone...?

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Seal off that entire deck with emergency force fields.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Wil... Data was down there.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Mister Worf... find Data if you can, but your top priority is isolating the Borg.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Understood.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Your efforts to assimilate me will be unsuccessful.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: It would appear that resistance is not always futile.

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: Brave words. I've heard them before from thousands of species across thousands of worlds... since long before you were created.

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: But now... they are all one with the Borg.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I am unlike any lifeform you have encountered before. As an android, I am in complete control of my neural net. The information contained there cannot be forcibly removed.

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: You are an imperfect being... created by an imperfect being. Finding your weakness is only a matter of time.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: How long has he been unconscious?

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: At least four hours.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: It looks like he has a cranial fracture, but I'll need X-rays to be sure.  Get Ruby in here.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: He has a severe fracture of the left occipital plate. He's not hemorrhaging... but the radiation has damaged his KNA and his APR cell count...

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: "APR cell count?" What the hell are you talking about?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Doctor Crusher has been... studying some advanced medical theories.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: What is that?

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: It's a... new medical scanner. It's a little more precise than an X-ray machine.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Is it Japanese?

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Um... yeah.  Now he's going to need a respirator. Do you have one?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: We have two... but we don't have the juice to run them.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Juice?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Power. There hasn't been a lot of wind through here for the last couple of weeks. Most of the batteries are depleted.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Don't you have any generators, or other fuel sources?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Maybe you'd like to take your patient to the hospital in Bozemen... it's only two hundred miles away.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: His automatic reflexes are fluctuating. We've got to get him on a respirator.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Bag him.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Beverly -- your tricorder.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Where's the battery room for the hospital?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: I told you, there's no --

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Outside, around back. Next to the water tank.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: His heartbeat's irregular...

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Adrenaline -- ten CC's!  As they rush to save him.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: One... two... three... compress!

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: What did you do to the batteries?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Oh... just a little tinkering. How is he?

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: He's stable... for now.  But it would be better if we could contact... our friends.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Yes. But until then, you'll have to make do with what you've got.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: That'll be interesting.

Speaker: ruby's voice
Dialogue: What happened to him?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: There was some kind of explosion out at the missile silo...

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Ruby, we're going to need a series of cranial X-rays tonight.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: I have a fresh set of plates at home. I'll have them here by eight.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Take care of him. He's a very special man.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Yes, he is.

Speaker: geordi's com voice
Dialogue: La Forge to Picard.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: I think there's someone in your pants.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Excuse me. I have a... telephone call.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Picard here.

Speaker: geordi's com voice
Dialogue: Captain, we have a problem. I think you'd better get back here.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I'm on my way. Picard out.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I have to go back to the silo. Will you be all right?

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: I'll be fine.  He's a different story.

Speaker: man's voice
Dialogue: Catch.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Think you'll need that.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: It's no zone solution.  You know. "No ozone."

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Oh...  yes... ultraviolet protection. Thank you. Mister...?

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Lieutenant, actually. Lieutenant Jonathan Scrimm. I'm the head of the Resurrection Protective Force.  And you are?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Jean-Luc Picard.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Great name. French?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: You don't sound French.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I was raised in England and here in the States. Thank you for the... no zone.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Where in the States?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Oh... here and there. You know how it is.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Not really. I was born and raised right here. Never had much use for travel.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Where are you from most recently?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: California. San Francisco.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Beautiful city. Used to be, anyway. I didn't think anyone still lived there.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: There's a few of us left.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: That was a pretty clever trick you did with the hospital's batteries. How'd you do it?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: It wasn't a trick. I used to be an electrical engineer.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Huh.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: And what were you doing out at the missile silo?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I'm an old friend of Cochrane's... I wanted to see how he was doing.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Lucky for him you came by when you did. He might be dead now.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Maybe you can tell me what he's been doing in that silo. We heard some explosions out there this morning...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I think he was running a test on an old rocket engine... and one of the fuel cells burst.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: You seem to have an answer for everything.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Something wrong with that?

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Not yet.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Be sure you put that on. You need a lot of protection around here.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Thank you. But I've never had much trouble protecting myself.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Worf to Bridge. We're in position.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: This is the Bridge. I'm releasing the emergency force fields.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Worf to Bridge.

Speaker: riker's com voice
Dialogue: Riker here.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: There's a dampening field in place on this deck. Our tricorders are useless.

Speaker: ensign hawk
Dialogue: What the hell is going on?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Borg...

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Worf to Bridge. We're about to enter the Environmental Control Room.

Speaker: riker's com voice
Dialogue: Any sign of Data, or the Borg themselves?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Negative. However, they've reconfigured the ODN network... and re-routed all power on this deck into Environmental Control.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Stand by, Commander  Where's Ensign Hawk?

Speaker: riker's com voice
Dialogue: Worf? Is something wrong?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Something is very wrong, Commander. We're falling back.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Fire at will!

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Fall back!

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Go, go, GO!

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Worf to Bridge -- force fields!

Speaker: riker's com voice
Dialogue: What the hell happened down there, Worf?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Commander... we have a problem.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Now here's the problem...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: It controls the thrust of the engines. It's been completely vaporized... and without it, there's no way to launch the ship.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Can you reconstruct the throttle valve?

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Yeah... if I knew what it looked like. There's probably five hundred ways to design a valve like this...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: We need to launch this ship in under eighteen hours...  There must be some design schematics... blueprints...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: We're tearing this place apart looking for them... but the computers are down, and the fires destroyed half the files...so far, nothing.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: If it was just part of the warp drive, I'd know what to do. But this... it's like trying to rebuild Orville Wright's airplane with canvass and sticks.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Wait a minute...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Yeah, I looked at these already.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: You can almost see the throttle assembly in this one... but this guy walked in front of it when they took the picture.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Could you reconstruct the throttle from a photograph like this... if that man wasn't blocking the view?

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Maybe...  Sure. Yeah. As long as I could get a clear look at the intake configuration. But so far, we haven't found any other photos.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: If there are other photographs... I think I may know how to find them.

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: Your resistance is... illogical. To us, your neural net is simply another piece of technology. We will learn its secrets.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: I am the Borg.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: That is a contradiction. The Borg act as a collective consciousness. There are no individuals.

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: I am the beginning... the end. I am the one who is many. I am the Borg.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: You are the guiding intelligence behind the Borg...?

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Intelligence... ambition... desire... I bring order to chaos...

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: It's unfortunate we will have to destroy you to obtain the information we need. You are a... unique lifeform.  Synthetic... and yet far more than a simple automaton. You have no idea how close to perfection you are.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: How do you define perfection?

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: A blending of the organic and the synthetic. The highest form of life in the galaxy.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: An interesting definition. But it is not one that applies to me. I am completely artificial. I have no organic components.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Have you ever wondered what it's like to have flesh?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: It is impossible to imagine sensations for which I have no frame of reference.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: That... can change.

Speaker: guard #1
Dialogue: Set phasers to rotating modulation!

Speaker: guard #1
Dialogue: That's it, they've adjusted -- fall back!

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: All right... we've lost control of eight decks... three Cargo Bays... one Shuttlebay.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Do we have any idea how many Borg we're dealing with?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: We saw at least thirty...and there are twenty-two Enterprise crewmembers reported missing... including Commander Data.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: We'll have to assume they've been assimilated into the Collective.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Even Data?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Data's positronic net contains classified information on the Enterprise. Command codes, security protocols...

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: If they control Data, they control the ship.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: We can't worry about that right now. Let's concentrate on what we can.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: To control the Enterprise, they'll have to gain access to one of two locations. Main Engineering... or the Bridge.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: We have to cover both possibilities.  We'll take care of the Bridge. Worf, take your men and seal off Main Engineering. Turn it into a fortress -- nothing gets in.

Speaker: ruby's voice
Dialogue: Shut that door!

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: What are you, an idiot? Didn't you see the red light was on?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Ah... yes... but, I didn't realize that --

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Thank God this plate was already fixed.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Cochrane?

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Yes... and I only had enough silver halide for one shot. So you're lucky you didn't screw it up.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I'm very sorry.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Don't worry about it.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Did you need something?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Yes... I wanted to ask you about some photographs I saw out at the silo. There were three of them... printed on some kind of fabric.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Bed sheets.  I used my last set of bed sheets to make those prints. Not the best material, but I haven't seen a clean piece of paper in five years.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Did you take any other pictures of the rocket?

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Sure.  Why, did you want to buy them?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Yes. I don't have any money right now, but I may be able to get some.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: "Money." So you can get dome money...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I can try.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: You'd have to try real hard. No one's used currency in over ten years. What are you, from another planet?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: No... but sometimes I feel that way.  What I meant was, I'd be willing to trade for the photographs.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Trade. Okay. The photographs... for a straight answer.  Who are you? And how do you know Zephram?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I'm an old friend... I met him when he was doing his undergraduate work at Cornell back in --

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: 'Fraid not.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: You're lying.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: What makes you say that?

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: You're not someone who lies very easily... so it's obvious when you do... at least to me.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Are you always sucha good judge of character?

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Always.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: The occipital fracture is widening... we're going to have to fuse the bones...

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: I'm a little worried about some of these bone fragments. If they move any closer to the brain, we could be looking at a hemorrhage.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Were the two of you... involved?

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: No... not like you and Doctor Crusher used to be.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: How did you know about that?

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: I didn't.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: We can't take any more X-rays until I can mix up a new batch of the silver halide.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Can you do it tonight? We may have to operate.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Sure. It'll be ready by morning.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Ruby... I need to talk to you about those photographs. It's very important.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: I'm sure it is. But it'll have to wait until tomorrow.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: It can't wait until tomorrow...

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Too bad.  Besides, it'll give you all night to think up a new set of lies.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Double check each assault phaser... make certain that the range setting is no more than thirty meters. We don't want to blast through the hull.

Speaker: security officer
Dialogue: Are you sure you don't want something a little more... sophisticated, sir?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Mind your post, Lieutenant.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Riker to Engineering. Mister Worf...the Borg are approaching your position.

Speaker: worf's com voice
Dialogue: Understood. We're ready.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Charge weapons!

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: They're bypassing Engineering...

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Where the hell are they going?

Speaker: borg queen's voice
Dialogue: Data...

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: You've taken your first step toward perfection. How does it feel?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I do not know what you are referring to.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: That's because you haven't been properly... stimulated yet.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Do you know what this is, Data?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: It would appear that you are attempting to graft organic skin onto my endo-skeletal structure.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: What a cold description... for such a beautiful gift.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Was that good for you?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: It was... interesting.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Do it again... please.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: You should pay closer attention to those little red lights.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: You know, I'd be perfectly justified in shooting you right now.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I'd say you already have.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Don't flatter yourself. I take pictures of a lot of junk.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Okay, let's hear it. I'm sure you have a great explanation for why those rocket photos are so important you broke into my house.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: We're trying to repair Doctor Cochrane's ship. It's been damaged and --

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: We?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Myself... and a few other friends of Zephram's.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Friends from Cornell...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Some.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Lie. That's one. Keep going.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: A key piece of the ship has been destroyed... and our only hope to reconstruct it is if one of your photographs shows us what it looked like.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: All right. Truth. I believe that one. Why is it so urgent you couldn't wait until morning?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: We have to launch his ship by tomorrow afternoon.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Or the shielding around the plutonium core will begin to deteriorate. Within a day, the entire silo will become so radioactive that no one will be able to come near it for a hundred years.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Lie. That's two. One more, and I pull the trigger.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Why are you being so difficult? All I'm asking for is to look at one of the photographs. It'll take five minutes.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: And all I'm asking for is the truth. That would take five minutes.  For all I know, you caused the explosions at the silo... and now you're trying to steal Zephram's ship.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I am not a thief...

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: No, you're a petty burglar and a liar...  You're no friend of Zephram's. He is a great man. He's not like you or me or any of the other zombies walking around this town.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: No. He's a man with vision. He can see beyond the problems that surround us. He knows there's a better future out there for everyone... a future where crime, poverty and war are things of the past... a future where we reach out and seek our destiny in the stars.  I believe in that future, too, Ruby. I believe in it in every fiber of my being. And I'm telling you... if we don't launch that warp ship tomorrow, there's a very good chance that future will never happen.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: You won't regret this.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: What are they doing?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: They appear to be modifying the deflector dish.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: To do what? If they wanted a weapon, they could've taken over a phaser bank or torpedo bay...

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Deflector dish... why the deflector dish...?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: It doesn't make sense. The deflector is only used for shielding and long range sensors...

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Computer -- magnify grid twenty- one alpha.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: They're re-routing the deflector power conduits...

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Computer -- thermal enhancement.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: They're connecting the conduits to subspace communications...

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: They're converting the deflector dish into an antennae...

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: They may be trying to send a message to the other Borg...the Borg in this time period...

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: What kind of message?

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: If it was me... I'd say "attack Earth now... in the 21st century... they'll be too strong in the 24th."

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: We have to stop them from sending that message.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Agreed. Options?

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Destroy the deflector dish.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Can we aim our dorsal phasers at it?

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: We've lost control of all weapons systems... Transporters are down... we can't get to a Shuttlecraft... and it would take us too long to fight our way down to deflector control...

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: There is another way, Commander. Do you remember your zero-G combat training?

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: I remember it made me sick.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: What are you suggesting?

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: I think Mister Worf is suggesting that we go outside for a little stroll...

Speaker: geordi's voice
Dialogue: I'm almost afraid to say this, Captain... but I think it's going to work.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Where's you get the alloy for the throttle itself?

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: They used copper pipes in their plumbing... so I melted it down... and fused it with some tritanium from one of our phaser casings.  It's not the strongest alloy... but it's better than all this crude aluminum and steel.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Mister Lange -- have you brought the computer systems back on-line yet?

Speaker: lange
Dialogue: Aye, Captain. This trinary language is pretty archaic... but I think I understand it now.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: picard's voice
Dialogue: Are we on schedule? The Vulcan ship will be here in less than two hours.

Speaker: geordi's voice
Dialogue: It'll be tight, but we should make it.

Speaker: picard's voice
Dialogue: What about our warp signature? It has to be strong enough for them to detect.

Speaker: geordi's voice
Dialogue: I've enhanced the plasma injectors -- don't worry, they'll see it.

Speaker: picard's voice
Dialogue: Well, with any luck... the Vulcans will land outside Resurrection tomorrow morning... and Earth will never be the same again.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: All right. I'd better start familiarizing myself with the flight controls.

Speaker: lange
Dialogue: Doctor Crusher's at the access hatch, Captain.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Let her in.

Speaker: cochrane
Dialogue: Let me get this straight... you're from the future... I'm about to change history... and all I have to do is sit here and let you fly my ship?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: cochrane
Dialogue: And people say I'm crazy...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I assure you, Doctor, that after today... no one will ever call you that again.

Speaker: cochrane
Dialogue: Just do me a favor... bring my ship back in one piece.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: That's a promise.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Doctor... my name is Geordi La Forge. I'm an engineer. Can I shake your hand?

Speaker: cochrane
Dialogue: I wish I could go with you. Is there anything I can do to help?

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Not really... but I do have about a thousand questions I've always wanted to ask you.

Speaker: cochrane
Dialogue: Since time is short... why don't you pick the top ten and fire away?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: You actually performed surgery...?

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: It was an experience. Metal scalpels... needle and thread...

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: But I had a little help. Surgical transporter. I used it to beam out most of the bone fragments from his brain.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: How did Doctor Almack react to that?

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: He was so confused by what I was doing, I don't think he even noticed.  Any word from the Enterprise?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Not yet.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: You think they're still up there?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: If they're not... we'd better get used to living in Montana.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: That might not be so bad... at least for you.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: What's that supposed to mean?

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: I saw the way you looker at her... and I know that look.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Regardless of how I may feel about Ruby... our fates lie along different paths. Nothing can change that.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: You want some advice? Don't do this again.  You know exactly what I mean.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Beverly, there were many reasons why you and I...

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: I'd call them excuses. And the first excuse on both our lists was our "sense of duty." We convinced ourselves that it was more important than anything else. And you know what? It's not.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I have a ship to launch.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: How do you feel?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Different.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: My internal sensors tell me the ambient temperature in the room is ten point two degrees Celsius...  But my skin tells me it is cold.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: My visual acuity has been reduced by seventy-eight percent... and I can no longer perceive light beyond the ultraviolet or the infrared...  But I can see.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Until today... your emotions were trapped inside an artificial shell. You didn't know what it was to truly feel.  All you have to do... is give us access to your neural net.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: No. I will not betray my friends.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: They're not your friends... they've held you back... kept you from your destiny...

Speaker: data
Dialogue: That is not true. They have tried to help me.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Have they given you what I have given you? Did they even try?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I... do not want this...

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: You're becoming more human all the time, Data. Now you're learning how to lie.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I wish to... go back to the way I was.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: More lies.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Have you ever know a woman? Do you know what it's like to feel her breath on your face... her skin against yours... flesh against flesh?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: My creator did not intend for me to experience these things.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: I'm your creator now.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: There's only one torpedo left...

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: I guess I'd better get it right the first time.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: The Borg will undoubtedly attack. Set phasers to rotating modulation.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Ready?

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Good luck.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Depressurize.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Activate magnetic constrictors.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Are you alright?

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Just a little queasy...

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Try not to look at the stars... keep your eyes on the ship.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: And Commander, whatever you do... do not vomit in your exo-suit. It would be... unpleasant.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: I'll keep that in mind.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Over and under!

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Worf! I'm going to need at least five minutes!

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Understood!

Speaker: geordi's voice
Dialogue: ATR setting...

Speaker: picard's voice
Dialogue: Active.

Speaker: geordi's voice
Dialogue: Main bus...

Speaker: picard's voice
Dialogue: Ready.

Speaker: geordi's voice
Dialogue: Initiate pre-ignition sequence.

Speaker: geordi's com voice
Dialogue: Pre-ignition sequence complete. Going to internal power.

Speaker: lange
Dialogue: Acknowledged, Phoenix. You're on internal power and ready for lift- off.

Speaker: geordi's com voice
Dialogue: Final launch sequence checks... complete. Ready to begin final countdown.

Speaker: lange
Dialogue: Understood. Begin five minute countdown on your mark.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Ready to make a little history?

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Always am.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Phoenix to control.  Initiating five minute countdown... mark.

Speaker: lange's com voice
Dialogue: Phoenix, we have a problem out here. There's a woman at the outer hatch... says her name's Ruby Sloan and she wants to see the Captain.

Speaker: lange's com voice
Dialogue: What do you want me to do, sir?

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: We can't let her in... she'll see Cochrane isn't making the flight.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: We can't leave her out there. When the ship launches... she'll be killed.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Tell her to go back to Resurrection.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: She's a very... determined woman.  Phoenix to control. Mister Lange... let her in.

Speaker: lange's com voice
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: lange
Dialogue: Ms. Sloane, if you'll have a seat, I'll let you talk to --

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Commander, you're five minutes are up!

Speaker: com officer
Dialogue: The Borg are charging the subspace emitters.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: How long until they can send a message?

Speaker: com officer
Dialogue: About seven or eight minutes.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Computer -- this is Commander Deanna Troi. Initiate self- destruct in six minutes, thirty seconds. Authorization Troi, gamma six five. Enable.

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Countdown underway. Self-destruct in six minutes, twenty-five seconds...

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: No good, sir. They're on internal power. We can't stop the launch from here.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: What about these doors?

Speaker: private
Dialogue: They're locked down tight from the inside.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: And those doors were made to withstand a nuclear attack.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: One minute to launch.

Speaker: scrimm's com voice
Dialogue: Mister Picard... this is Lieutenant Scrimm. I'm going to have to insist that you shut down the launch. You see, I know what you're doing... and I'm not going to just stand by and let it happen.  Stop the launch, or I'll kill every one of your people out here... and I think you know who'll be first.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Say hello...

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Launch the ship.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Go ahead -- launch it. Ruby will be here when you get back... but she won't have a whole lot to say.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Captain --

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: This is Picard. I've suspended the launch sequence.

Speaker: scrimm's com voice
Dialogue: Thanks. Now, why don't you join us and we'll have a little talk?

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Captain... we've got less than ten minutes before that Vulcan ship leaves the system. We've got to go now.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: It'll have to wait. Come on.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Geordi, can you see into the room?

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: No... the door's too thick.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Then we'll just have to assume it's still there...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: What's still there?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Get a tricorder. You're going to have to track my exact position in that room...

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Self-destruct in three minutes...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: What do you want?

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: The invasion plans.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Invasion.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: These people you're calling "Vulcans"... who are they? Where do they come from? How many troops? What kind of weapons?

Speaker: ensign
Dialogue: Tractor beam engaged. We've got 'em, Commander.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: Prismify the beam. Get rid of that Borg.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Don't look at the stars... don't look at the stars...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: There is no invasion...

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Wrong answer, Mister Picard. Try again.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: All right. You want the truth...  The Vulcans... are highly intelligent aliens.

Speaker: scrimm's com voice
Dialogue: Aliens... that's what I thought. From where... Canada?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: From another planet.  Oh, I almost forgot... they have green blood and pointed ears.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: And you know all this... because you're a space-man too...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I'm afraid you've caught me. I am a space-man.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Truth... he's telling the truth...

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: You're an entertaining man, Mister Picard. But you're also full of shit.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Now, Geordi!

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Actually, you're full of shit.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Now, tell your men to drop their weapons.

Speaker: scrimm
Dialogue: Weapons... down.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Are you all --

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: I think you have a plane to catch.

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Self-destruct in fifeteen seconds... fourteen... thirteen... twelve...

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Nine... eight... seven...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Solid rocket fuel at twenty-five thousand kilograms...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Altitude fifty kilometers...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Entering the upper ionospere...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: There's a red light on the second intake valve.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Ignore it. We'll be fine.  Prepare for first stage shut-down and separation on my mark...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Three... two... one... mark!

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: A Borg in all but name.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I am... grateful for what you have given me. But I still do not wish to be assimilated.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: A universe of sensation is waiting for you... don't you want to explore it... with me?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Then take the final step... give me the Enterprise... and we can be together... always.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: No... I cannot.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: I've deactivated the sensory inputs. That flesh on your body is just meat, now.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: No... no, please... you cannot...

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: You must give me what I want... now. Without the deflector dish, we can no longer send for an early invasion. We must assimilate Earth ourselves. I need this ship.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Isn't it better like this...?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Yes... but the Enterprise... my duty...

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: ... is to yourself. Don't make me hurt you again...

Speaker: data
Dialogue: No... no, it's so... empty... please... give it back... I need it...

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: And I need to control this ship. Let me into your mind.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: In order to access my neural net... you will need to create a positronic interface.  I will tell you how.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Ready to deploy the warp nacelles.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: As they used to say... all systems are go.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: The Vulcans should be out there right now. We need to break the warp barrier in the next five minutes if we're going to get their attention.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Bring the warp core on-line. I'll lay in a heading.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: The nacelles are charged... nuclear warhead standing by. We're ready to ignite the warp drive.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Engage.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Warp field looks good... structural integrity holding...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Speed... twenty thousand kilometers per second.

Speaker: troi
Dialogue: I have to admit there was a moment there when --

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Hold that thought.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Strong heart. Weak stomach.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Report!

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: We've lost Bridge control!

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Emergency override!

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I am re-routing Bridge command functions to this location.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Eliminate their remaining defenses. I will send Borg to assimilate the rest of the crew.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: There is a perimeter alert. A ship has entered sensor range.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Vulcan?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Give me helm control.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Passing one-half light speed. The starboard nacelle's running a little hot...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: I'm on it...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: The inertial dampers are having trouble compensating... I don't think Cochrane built this thing for comfort.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Speed -- two hundred, seventy-five thousand kilometers per second.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: There's no temporal shielding in here! We're starting to pick up relativistic effects!

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: One minute to warp threshold...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Captain, the Enterprise!

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Picard to Enterprise -- do you read me?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Their com system must still be down.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Well, I feel a whole lot better with them out there. We may need some help.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I have repaired the weapons array. Phasers are on-line.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: The targeting lock isn't working.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I do not understand. The optical data network has been repaired, and all systems are functioning.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Your diagnostics are in error. I need weapons.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: The problem must lie in the interface between Starfleet and Borg technology. Your console may not be configured to handle the data flow.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Can you configure it?

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I believe so.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Do it.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Approaching light speed...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: They're getting awfully close... what the hell are they doing?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: We're crossing the threshold!

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I believe I see the problem.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Bring us about...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Dropping out of warp.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Let's begin the landing procedure.

Speaker: borg queen
Dialogue: Data...

Speaker: picard's voice
Dialogue: Isn't anyone going to say welcome back?

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Did it work?

Speaker: cochrane
Dialogue: Mister La Forge... now I'd like to shake your hand.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Doctor Cochrane... this is your moment.

Speaker: cochrane
Dialogue: My God... they're really from another world?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: That's right. And they're going to want to meet the man who flew that warp ship.

Speaker: cochrane
Dialogue: And that's supposed to be me...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Zephram, you had the vision to build that ship when no one else on this planet could see beyond their own problems.  You flew that ship... all I did was push a few buttons.

Speaker: cochrane
Dialogue: All right.  And don't worry -- I'll keep your secret.

Speaker: vulcan
Dialogue: Live Long and Prosper.

Speaker: cochrane
Dialogue: Um... thanks.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Riker to Enterprise. Five to beam up.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: You're leaving, aren't you?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: I have to...

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Where? And don't tell me San Francisco...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: No. It's a lot further than that.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: It's the future, isn't it? Just like you told Scrimm.  I knew you weren't from around here.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: No... I'm from France.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: I don't care if you're from France or Venus... just take me with you.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: That's impossible.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: This may be hard for you to understand... but I'm duty-bound not to interfere with you, or anyone else here... any more than is absolutely necessary.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: You've been interfering with my life ever since I met you.  Don't stop now.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Ruby... I'm sorry.  But our fates lie along different paths.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Picard to Enterprise. One to...

Speaker: riker's com voice
Dialogue: Riker here. Captain, we didn't get your whole transmission.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: To hell with fate.

Speaker: riker's com voice
Dialogue: Say again, Captain?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Enterprise. Two to beam up.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: How's Mister Data?

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: He's in Sickbay. Doctor Crusher says he can be repaired... but we have to wait until we...

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Return to our own time?

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Then make it so. Have you determined how to recreate the temporal vortex?

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Yes, sir. But Captain... are we... all going back?

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Unless you'd like to stay.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: No, sir.

Speaker: riker
Dialogue: Bridge to Engineering. Mister La Forge... initiate the temporal vortex.

Speaker: worf
Dialogue: Incoming transmission from Starfleet Command. Admiral Hayes.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Onscreen.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Admiral... what's the status of the Borg fleet?

Speaker: admiral hayes
Dialogue: It's been destroyed. The Borg threat is over.  Are you all right? The Enterprise disappeared from our sensors for a moment.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: We're fine, sir. It will take some... time to explain.

Speaker: admiral hayes
Dialogue: I look forward to reading your report.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: That makes two of us.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: No, no -- we'll have to rip out this entire bulkhead. We'll need new bracing members for the deck above and below.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Data...

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: You look good as new.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: You could say that I'm back to my old self.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: That's great.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: Her remains... are they still here?

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: I'm sending them to the Daystrom Institute for analysis.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: I never realized how powerful an emotion temptation could be.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: Temptation? You said in your report it was all a ruse... you were manipulating her.

Speaker: data
Dialogue: She was... a unique lifeform. In her own way... nearly perfect.

Speaker: geordi
Dialogue: It almost sounds like you miss her.

Speaker: picard
Dialogue: Welcome home.
